lines.text: Well, me and my pals, we're musicians. We were tearin' up some hot swing music in the York Esther. Gail over there was swingin' her fans. Her sweetie Koik Robin was inhalin' a bottle of hooch over at a table. And a hoofer by the name of Buck Wing was gettin' ready to shake his tootsies.
Kindly speak English and drop the vernacular.

[Holding his Derby hat]
Vernaculah? That's a doiby!
Drop the vernacular!
[Curly drops his hat]
No, no, not that! I mean talk so the jury can understand!
Is everybody dumb?
I say, Jasper, what comes after seventy-five?
Seventy-six!
That's the Spirit!
Take the stand.

[picks the chair up]
Where'll I put it?
No, no, take the stand!
I got it! Now what'll I do with it?

[angrily sets it back down]
SIDDOWN!
Mr. Howard, kindly tell the court what you know about Kirk Robbin's murder.

[to the Judge]
Well, it was like this, Mr. Court...
Address the judge as your honor.

[to the Judge]
Well, it was like this, my honor...
"Your honor". Not "My honor".
Why? Don't you like him?

[to Larry]
You're in court, not the woods, Tarzan.

[to the Stooges]
Gentlemen, you must control your killing instincts.

[to Curly]
Grab your ear.
[Curly grabs it]
Come on!
[Moe grabs Curly's arm, and drags him off]
[Larry shatters his violin]
Oh, my Stradavarius. Oh, my beautiful Stradavarius.
Why don't you answer him?
He's tawkin' pig Latin! I dunno what he's sayin'!
He's asking you if you swear...!

[cuts the judge off]
No, but I know all the woids!
He's asking you if you'll swear to tell the truth.
Truth is stranger than fiction, Judgie-Wudgle.
Now Gaily's dance was over. I stuck my head in the office door, and I saw Koik Robin and Buck Wing ahgyin' over by the parrot cage!
What were they arguing about?
I dunno! But Buck Wing was sizzlin' like a hot hamboiguh! He grabs Koik by the neck like that, see, and drags him over to the letter press, see?
[Demonstrates on Curly]
Then he smacks him on the head like that!
[Continues demonstration on Curly]

Then he pokes his coconut into the letter press, see? Like that! Then he says, "I'll squeeze the cider outta yer Adam's apple!" Then he gives him the woiks, like this! Then he keeps toinin! And twistin'! And that, ladies and gentlemen, is the...
[the grind of the letter press suddenly starts spinning counterclockwise, flying into the air and landing on Moe's head]
I'm a victim of circumstance.
I'm no mule.
No, your ears are too short.
[eye pokes Curly]
So I'm a mule.
[With Curly taking the oath, the court clerk is speaking rapidly]
Are you trying to give me the double talk?
I'll SUE you for this.
Oh, sue-perstitious eh?

[after Curly picks up all the jacks on one bounce of the ball]
Hey! What's the idea of spoiling the game?
I was for onesies.
Well here's twosies.
[eye pokes Curly on "twosies", and Curly responds in pain]

[sounding cute]
He did a onesie, you give 'em to...
[stops when he sees Moe looking at him angrily]

[to Larry]
Here's fivesies.
[smacks him]

[to the defense attorney after he inadvertantly hugged her after the bullet from the gun used as evidence grazes his backside]
Broadlane-9972! After 5 o'clock.

[while playing violin, he picks up the defense's black hairpiece on the end of his bow and sees it]
A taran-tela!
[Moe screams, Curly tries hitting it with a hammer, and Moe steals the bailiff's gun and shoots]
Oh! A field mouse!

[with it attached to his bow]
Watch out, it'll bite ya!

[sees it]
Taran-tella? Shot five holes in a dibbit!
